bug.author: Rm1n90
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>‚ùîQuestion</denchmark-h>
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/glenn-jocher>@glenn-jocher</denchmark-link> , After pulling the code to the last commit, I cannot train the model anymore! It was fine before and I was able to train without any problem on my custom dataset. Now, I'm getting this error during the validation . I can get rid of the error with and but I don't know why I am getting the error. <denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code> File "train.py", line 508, in <module> train(hyp, opt, device, tb_writer, wandb) File "train.py", line 348, in train results, maps, times = test.test(opt.data, File "/home/detection/test.py", line 99, in test for batch_i, (img, targets, paths, shapes) in enumerate(tqdm(dataloader, desc=s)): File "/home/anaconda3/envs/lib/python3.8/site-packages/tqdm/std.py", line 1171, in __iter__ for obj in iterable: File "/home/detection/utils/datasets.py", line 105, in __iter__ yield next(self.iterator) File "/home/anaconda3/envs/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 435, in __next__ data = self._next_data() File "/home/anaconda3/envs/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 1085, in _next_data return self._process_data(data) File "/home/anaconda3/envs/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 1111, in _process_data data.reraise() File "/home/anaconda3/envs/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/_utils.py", line 428, in reraise raise self.exc_type(msg) AttributeError: Caught AttributeError in DataLoader worker process 1. Original Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/anaconda3/envs/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/worker.py", line 198, in _worker_loop data = fetcher.fetch(index) File "/home/anaconda3/envs/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/fetch.py", line 44, in fetch data = [self.dataset[idx] for idx in possibly_batched_index] File "/home/anaconda3/envs/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/utils/data/_utils/fetch.py", line 44, in <listcomp> data = [self.dataset[idx] for idx in possibly_batched_index] File "/home/detection/utils/datasets.py", line 571, in __getitem__ if x.size > 0: AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'size' </denchmark-code>

comments.comment:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Rm1n90>@Rm1n90</denchmark-link> , thank you for your interest in YOLOv5! Please visit our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki#tutorials>Tutorials</denchmark-link> to get started, where you can find quickstart guides for simple tasks like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Train-Custom-Data>Custom Data Training</denchmark-link> all the way to advanced concepts like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/607>Hyperparameter Evolution</denchmark-link> . If this is a üêõ Bug Report, please provide screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue, otherwise we can not help you. If this is a custom training Question, please provide as much information as possible, including dataset images, training logs, screenshots, and a public link to online <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Train-Custom-Data#visualize>W&B logging</denchmark-link> if available. For business inquiries or professional support requests please visit <denchmark-link:https://www.ultralytics.com>https://www.ultralytics.com</denchmark-link> or email Glenn Jocher at <denchmark-link:mailto:glenn.jocher@ultralytics.com>glenn.jocher@ultralytics.com</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h2>Requirements</denchmark-h>
Python 3.8 or later with all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/requirements.txt>requirements.txt</denchmark-link> dependencies installed, including . To install run: $ pip install -r requirements.txt <denchmark-h:h2>Environments</denchmark-h>
YOLOv5 may be run in any of the following up-to-date verified environments (with all dependencies including <denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda>CUDA</denchmark-link> /<denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn>CUDNN</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://www.python.org/>Python</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/>PyTorch</denchmark-link> preinstalled):
Google Colab Notebook with free GPU: Kaggle Notebook with free GPU: https://www.kaggle.com/ultralytics/yolov5 Google Cloud Deep Learning VM. See GCP Quickstart Guide Docker Image https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov5. See Docker Quickstart Guide
<denchmark-h:h2>Status</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/workflows/CI%20CPU%20testing/badge.svg></denchmark-link>
If this badge is green, all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/actions>YOLOv5 GitHub Actions</denchmark-link> Continuous Integration (CI) tests are currently passing. CI tests verify correct operation of YOLOv5 training (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/train.py>train.py</denchmark-link> ), testing (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/test.py>test.py</denchmark-link> ), inference (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/detect.py>detect.py</denchmark-link> ) and export (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/models/export.py>export.py</denchmark-link> ) on MacOS, Windows, and Ubuntu every 24 hours and on every commit.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Rm1n90>@Rm1n90</denchmark-link> Hello, thank you for your interest in YOLOv5! This issue seems to lack the minimum requirements for a proper response, or is insufficiently detailed for us to help you. Please note that most technical problems are due to:
Your modified or out-of-date code. If your issue is not reproducible in a new git clone version of this repo we can not debug it. Before going further run this code and verify your issue persists:
$ git clone https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5 yolov5_new # clone latest $ cd yolov5_new $ python detect.py # verify detection
# CODE TO REPRODUCE YOUR ISSUE HERE
Your custom data. If your issue is not reproducible in one of our 3 common datasets (COCO, COCO128, or VOC) we can not debug it. Visit our Custom Training Tutorial for guidelines on training your custom data. Examine train_batch0.jpg and test_batch0.jpg for a sanity check of your labels and images.
Your environment. If your issue is not reproducible in one of the verified environments below we can not debug it. If you are running YOLOv5 locally, verify your environment meets all of the requirements.txt dependencies specified below. If in doubt, download Python 3.8.0 from https://www.python.org/, create a new venv, and then install requirements.
If none of these apply to you, we suggest you close this issue and raise a new one using the Bug Report template, providing screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue. Thank you! <denchmark-h:h2>Requirements</denchmark-h>
Python 3.8 or later with all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/requirements.txt>requirements.txt</denchmark-link> dependencies installed, including . To install run: $ pip install -r requirements.txt <denchmark-h:h2>Environments</denchmark-h>
YOLOv5 may be run in any of the following up-to-date verified environments (with all dependencies including <denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda>CUDA</denchmark-link> /<denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn>CUDNN</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://www.python.org/>Python</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/>PyTorch</denchmark-link> preinstalled):
Google Colab Notebook with free GPU: Kaggle Notebook with free GPU: https://www.kaggle.com/ultralytics/yolov5 Google Cloud Deep Learning VM. See GCP Quickstart Guide Docker Image https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov5. See Docker Quickstart Guide
<denchmark-h:h2>Status</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/workflows/CI%20CPU%20testing/badge.svg></denchmark-link>
If this badge is green, all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/actions>YOLOv5 GitHub Actions</denchmark-link> Continuous Integration (CI) tests are passing. These tests evaluate proper operation of basic YOLOv5 functionality, including training (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/train.py>train.py</denchmark-link> ), testing (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/test.py>test.py</denchmark-link> ), inference (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/detect.py>detect.py</denchmark-link> ) and export (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/models/export.py>export.py</denchmark-link> ) on MacOS, Windows, and Ubuntu.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Rm1n90>@Rm1n90</denchmark-link> this seems to be a bug in master, will debug. Thanks for spotting!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Rm1n90>@Rm1n90</denchmark-link> this should be resolved in PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/pull/1513>#1513</denchmark-link> . Please git pull and try again.
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/glenn-jocher>@glenn-jocher</denchmark-link> , Yes, solved the issue, Thanks

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Rm1n90>@Rm1n90</denchmark-link> please delete all *.cache files in your dataset, as these may have been corrupted before by the bug. Then everything will work correctly.
